meanings.definition: The act of making something normal or standard.
meanings.sent1: The normalizations of the school rules helped create a fair environment for all students.
meanings.sent2: She believed in the importance of normalizations in society to promote equality.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show exaggerated the normalizations of office behavior for laughs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the normalizations of beauty standards are constantly changing.
meanings.sent5: The normalizations of language usage vary greatly across different cultures.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something back to a normal state.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the normalizations of the power grid were a top priority for the repair crew.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the importance of normalizations in the patient's recovery.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was the ability to speed up the normalizations of any damaged object.
meanings.sent4: The normalizations of the economy after the recession took years to achieve.
meanings.sent5: The normalizations of the temperature in the room made it comfortable for everyone.

meanings.definition: The adjustment of values to fit within a certain range.
meanings.sent1: The normalizations of the data were necessary to ensure accurate analysis.
meanings.sent2: Engineers focused on the normalizations of the measurements to avoid errors in the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret recipe included the normalizations of spices for the perfect flavor.
meanings.sent4: The normalizations of the budget allowed for better financial planning.
meanings.sent5: The normalizations of the color palette brought harmony to the painting.
